bibl.title: William Stewart to Walt Whitman, 17 July 1865

revisionDesc.change: corrected orgName, added choice tags, pbs

body.p:
Sir iI take my pen in hand to let you know that iI am well and iI hope that these few lines may find you the same iI have not got a way yet from this hospittlehospital but iI think that my papers will be down tomorrow iI think that they will get away this week iI think that iI have been here long enough now mister whitmanWhitman tel me what is the matter that you dontdon't come to see me anymore iI hope that dontdon't keep you away what the ward master told you that
night iI did not think to ask you to come back Now if you have any lasureleisure time, come and see me before iI go home. iI am sorry that iI did not think to tell you to not mind what he told you Well iI must [close] My letter by bidding you good by write soon
